title: E bay not working on Firefox.
content: Just recently when i open ebay.co.uk or.com all I get is a list of ebay categories down the left hand side in blue.If I try to proceed everything goes extra large and e bay says there is a problem. It works in Android phone but is the same problem in chrome. I do need to use ebay during lockdown when I am confined to the house and want new supplies. I am not very tech minded so please help and sort this out for me. Many thanks and kind regards to all.David.

title: video windows always working even when the option is unchecked.
content:
Hi all, sorry for the level in English. I'm French.

I am fed up with these video which go down right just when scrolling down after their place in the page.

Example : https://www.maxisciences.com/village/un-village-espagnol-disparu-depuis-60-ans-ressurgit-a-cause-de-la-secheresse_art39830.html (the video is long to download but once done, I have just to scroll down, and as soon as a part of the video has disappeared on the top, the video moves down right).

I have unchecked the option General -> Navigation -> Activate controls for the video overlays (if well translated), but it changes nothing. Would be pleased to have the solution for this issue.

Thank you all Bobby.

title: Internal error TA-1437
content: An error has started happening on Firefox. When I visit the BBC website - https://www.bbc.co.uk/ - and I click on the 'Sport' button, it returns the error message 'Not found. Please check your DNS. Internal reference TA-1437.' I checked with the BBC, but they suggested the error lies with the browser. I can confirm this, as I tried the same button using Microsoft edge, and it works fine, and gets me through to the sports page. Is this an error you are aware of? I am on Firefox version 82.0.2 (64-bit) in windows 10. This has only recently started happening. Is there an earlier version of Firefox that I can roll back to - if so, how do I do that? Thanks for your help, John
creator: wolvercote-john

title: audio not working (since the question to allow microphone acces does not show up)
content:
Good day everybody, I stumbled across the issue mentioned in the title. I need BBB for meetings and online lessons. When activating audio, a little notification should show up, asking for mic access permission (i tried it on firefox on another pc and it worked there). However, on my pc, this doesn't happen. I also tried other websites where mic access is needed, but it's the same story: the pop up does not show up.

Microphone access is not disabled in the privacy settings; when I lookup the permissions on a page that requires a microphone, it says that there are no special permissions for the page.

I also tried a different browser and it worked there, therefore I assume it's not in the windows settings (Firefox has permission to access the microphone).

I updated Firefox as well as Flash.


Any idea how to get this running?

Thanks in advance, m
creator: mariwe99

title: how to resolve a 502 bad gateway error
content:
I cant close a crm program Apptivo. I am still logged in after shuting down the computer and I get this clean page saying 502 Bad Gateway with small writing underneath saying nginx

That's it
creator: gary.wolff

title: Firefox Dark Mode Theme
content:
I have Firefox set to dark mode in the theme settings. How do I block websites from seeing this information? I don't understand why website like eBay and DuckDuckGo think they can change how I view there website becasue of my setting in Firefox. I completely understand that this may be a convenience for some people, my point is though if there is an option for it, where is the option against it! Some websites look terrible in dark mode! Also why do websites need so much information about my computer and browser when I visit them? Why can't I bock this as well? Why does a website need to know what operating system I run. My point is.. if it's not necessary for the website to work then it should not be shared. privacy!

Believe it or not, I'm a human and make mistakes. I like my free will. I like to make stupid and illogical decisions sometimes, I like to make mistakes, and learn from them. Why are algorithms trying to control my life? I don't want a perfect utopian life run by machines that have no soul.
creator: farcry881

Never had this problem before with any other version. I see some people had the same problem with v. 60.

Thank you for any suggestions.

title: Error Message ONLY with Firefox browser
content:
(Access Denied You don't have permission to access "http://www.costco.com/" on this server.

Reference #18.a7f00f17.1604805009.3a9c2ba )

That an error message I receive when trying to access www.costo.com on Firefox.

Earlier posts (2017) suggested this is a VPN problem. Disable the VPN and Cosco, com comes up. Well I use a VPN for security and I don't want to disable it to shop at Costco. I don't have that problem with Opera or Chrome, so it must be a Firefox problem. I like Firefox and prefer to use it, but this problem is disappointing. I'm surprised that no one involved with Firefox has solved it yet (no disrespect to the volunteers who spend many hours trying to fix things). It must be a tricky problem. Any ideas other than disabling my VPN. That's not going to happen.

title: Zotero - How to get it to work with FF bookmarks
content:
Some people recommended here using Zotero in order to keep the functionality of the "Description" field in bookmarks which was taken away after v. 62. Unfortunately a) There is zero information here on actually using it and achieving any sort of acceptable results re: bookmarks, and b) It's complicated and it doesn't even import the bookmarks file.

I installed Zotero v 5. Have to also install Zotero for Firefox extension. This is hidden in documentation (one or the other does basically nothing, have to install both). I tried to import FF bookmarks.html, it proceeded to use 50% of CPU resources, memory used by the program went up to 800 MB, and after 15 minutes the import bar was at 0%. I tried to import the bookmarks.json file, it doesn't support it.

Any suggestions?
creator: elzach

title: firefox someetimes won't open,  won't close, can't force quit on Mac
content:
Hello

I'm on iMac Catalina 10.15.7 and Firefox 82.0.2. Ever since upgrading to Catalina Firefox has been giving me problem. When trying to start Firefox sometimes it starts right up. Most times the icon just bounces in my dock. sometimes after maybe 1 to 5 minutes it will start. Other times it never starts. I can't force quit it.

Just a while ago I went to open my Firefox and nothing. Didn't move. No dot below the icon in the dock to let me know it's already open.

Okay I keep a new dmg file so tried to reinstall it. Error message says can't install because Firefox is in use.

Had to manually turn off the iMac and re-start for Firefox to open.

Too may issues here. It all started when upgrading to Catalina. Finally had to come here to try to find a solution.

No crash report because it's not crashing. just won't start or quit most times. Thanks Allen
creator: AllenZag
